solution_line_template: For 1 hour on a rainy day, Ken can cycle {twenty_min_intervals_per_hour}*{rain_miles_per_20_min}={miles_per_rainy_hour} miles.

For 1 hour on a snowy day, Ken can cycle {twenty_min_intervals_per_hour}*{snow_miles_per_20_min}=<<{twenty_min_intervals_per_hour}*{snow_miles_per_20_min}={miles_per_snowy_hour}>>{miles_per_snowy_hour} miles.
On the rainy days this week, Ken cycled {miles_per_rainy_hour}*{rain_days}=<<{miles_per_rainy_hour}*{rain_days}={total_miles_rainy_days}>>{total_miles_rainy_days} miles.
On the snow days of the week, Ken cycled {miles_per_snowy_hour}*{snow_days}=<<{miles_per_snowy_hour}*{snow_days}={total_miles_snowy_days}>>{total_miles_snowy_days} miles.
In total, Ken cycled {total_miles_snowy_days}+{total_miles_rainy_days}=<<{total_miles_snowy_days}+{total_miles_rainy_days}={total_miles_week}>>{total_miles_week} miles this week.
